channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Sam Bankman-Fried's life on bail: Armed guards, daily jogs and gawkers
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Luke Huigsloot
item.description: Compared to his prison accommodations in The Bahamas, the former billionaire appears to be living a pretty decent life while under house arrest.

item.title: California regulator warns of 17 crypto websites suspected of fraud
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: The last time the DFPI sent out such a large batch of crypto scam alerts was in June when it sounded the alarm over 26 dubious crypto platforms.

item.title: What to expect from crypto the year after FTX
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Amit Chaudhary
item.description: Users are still seeking to move their funds away from centralized exchanges, paving the way for blockchain-based alternatives to thrive.

item.title: 3Commas CEO confirms API key leak following warning from CZ
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: The Binance CEO was less than receptive to claims of losses due to a 3Comma API key leak earlier this month; now he recommends disabling 3Comma API keys.

item.title: Which celebrities joined and left crypto in 2022?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Christiaan Vos
item.description: Sports players, movie stars, models, musicians; the gang's all here, with more celebrities entering the blockchain space with each passing month. Will that trend continue in 2023?

item.title: Bankman-Fried may enter plea in NY federal court next week before Judge Lewis Kaplan
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Derek Andersen
item.description: Bankman-Fried has claimed repeatedly that he does not consider himself to have criminal liability in the collapse of FTX, but his colleagues have already pleaded guilty.

item.title: Binance's cloud mining affected by extreme weather conditions in North America
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Users' subscriptions to cloud mining products have been extended for three days due to the power outage.

item.title: Fidelity plans NFT marketplace: Nifty Newsletter, Dec. 21–27
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: Investment firm Fidelity recently filed trademarks that showed its intentions to enter the NFT and metaverse space.

item.title: Bitcoin price bottom not in, data says as whale orders hit 2-year low
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: A lack of excitement on order books is just one sign that downside volatility could easily resume, says Material Indicators.

item.title: Price analysis 12/28: BTC, ETH, BNB, XRP, DOGE, ADA, MATIC, DOT, LTC, UNI
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Bitcoin and select altcoins have turned down from overhead resistance levels, indicating that bears remain in control.

item.title: MicroStrategy adds to Bitcoin stake despite steep loss
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The value of the firm‘s Bitcoin holdings has declined 45%, with an average purchase price of $30,397.

item.title: Bitcoin beats Tesla stock in 2022 as BTC price heads for 60% losses
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: Bitcoin may be in line for worse losses in the new year, analysts say, but BTC price action has a least fared better than TSLA.

item.title: China’s first national NFT marketplace to launch next week: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Zhiyuan Sun
item.description: The state-backed platform will serve as a secondary market for NFTs and digital asset copyrights.

item.title: Bitcoin underperforms stocks, gold for the first time since 2018
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.description: Bitcoin’s yearly losses are similar to high-profile stocks like Tesla and Meta, with BTC investors down 70% in 2022.

item.title: ‘Make sure Ethereum wins’ — Steve Newcomb reveals zkSync’s prime directive
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Elias Ahonen

item.title: Scammers impersonate US State Department, claiming to help affected FTX users
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: The Oregon Division of Financial Regulation urged investors to do due diligence before putting their funds on any crypto platform.

item.title: What is browser-based cryptocurrency mining, and how does it work?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Deer
item.description: Browser-based cryptocurrency mining has made a comeback, allowing casual miners to earn rewards.

item.title: The Agenda podcast explores how DAOs can strengthen workers’ rights
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ray Salmond
item.description: TheCaféDAO and TheLaborDAO sit down with The Agenda to discuss how decentralized autonomous organizations can revolutionize the fight for workers’ rights.

item.title: Bitcoin bears well positioned for Friday's $2.5 billion options expiry
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Marcel Pechman
item.description: BTC bears are outnumbered based on open interest volume, but bulls' hopes of $20,000 before 2023 have already been hampered.

item.title: Crypto investors sue Winklevoss twins over interest accounts on Gemini
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: The plaintiffs allege that the products were not registered, which prevented them from receiving disclosures to better assess the risks of using Gemini Earn.

item.title: Canaan expects minor revenue drop in 2022 despite crypto mining crisis
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: Crypto mining firm Canaan expects its annual RMB-denominated revenue to drop less than 15% despite the crypto market cap plummeting 70% this year.

item.title: Midas Investments closes down amid $63M DeFi portfolio deficit
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: Midas CEO Iakov Levin said that after the Terra, FTX and Celsius collapse, users withdrew more than 60% of their assets under management.

item.title: SBF wants ‘Big Short’ FTX movie, Peter Schiff already calls it fiction
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: The crypto community was not happy with the news that Big Short writer Michael Lewis met with the former FTX CEO.

item.title: FTX customers file class-action lawsuit to get priority reparations
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By David Attlee
item.description: Customer class members don’t want to stand in line along the creditors of a failed crypto platform.

item.title: Argo Blockchain sells top mining facility to Galaxy Digital for $65M
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: Argo Blockchain reduces its total debt by $41 million by selling its flagship Helios mining facility and getting a $35 million loan from Galaxy.

item.title: Alameda wallets become active days after SBF bail, community mulls foul play
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: The recent movement of funds from Alameda wallets just days after Sam Bankman Fried was released on bail raised many eyebrows about the timing.

item.title: China’s CBDC wallet resorts to ages-old tradition to boost adoption
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Jesse Coghlan
item.description: A traditional Chinese way of gifting money that’s gone virtual with the rise of digital payments has been introduced into the digital yuan wallet app.

item.title: Executives from $1.5B South Korean crypto exchange fraud jailed
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: The latest court action now takes the number of V Global execs behind bars up to seven, as the CEO was previously sentenced to a 22-year prison term.

item.title: Kraken quits Japan for the second time, blaming a ‘weak crypto market’
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Felix Ng
item.description: The crypto exchange said it will deregister from Japan’s Financial Services Agency as a crypto asset exchange operator from Jan. 31.

item.title: Defrost Finance breaks silence on ‘exit scam’ accusations, denies rug pull
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Felix Ng
item.description: Defrost Finance had not publicly commented on the rug-pull accusations in the media until now.
